title: How to watch I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here online for free in UK and abroad
author: alice-marshall
summary: The last few nights in the castle camp before a winner is crowned
article: From Paralympians to TV presenters, actors to ex-Premier League footballers, Ant and Dec returned to host one of Britain's most popular reality TV shows as 10 more celebrities competed to become King or Queen of the Jungle Castle! With the I'm a Celeb Final taking place this Sunday, there are just a couple of days left, likely filled with grim Trials and further eliminations. Find out how to watch I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here 2021 online before it's all over.
For a second year in a row, I'm a Celeb broke tradition, swapping the tropical heat of Springbrook National Park in New South Wales, Australia for... Gwrych Castle, Wales.

Following a break in transmission due to Storm Arwen, we've dived into the last couple of weeks of I'm a Celebrity with emotional letters from home and, as the competition ramped up, an elimination every month.

While Richard Madeley made an early exit due to his health, Arlene Phillips was the first official contestant to be voted out by the public, followed by Paralympian Kadenna Cox, Radio 1 Xtra DJ Snoochie Shy, and DJ and record producer Naughty Boy.
On Thursday night, Louise Minchin, former BBC Breakfast presenter, was next go.

This leaves late arrivals Adam Woodyatt and Simon Gregson, known for their respective roles in Eastenders and Coronation Street, in the camp, as well as The Saturday's pop star Frankie Bridge, former footballer David Ginola, Olympic diver Matty Lee, and Emmerdale actor Danny Miller.
With further eliminations sure to take place in the lead up to the final this Sunday, make sure you know how to watch I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here 2021 online where you are.

From revolting Bushtucker Trials to Castle Coin challenges, don't miss a moment of the action at Gwrych Castle. While you may face geo-restrictions if you're abroad when new episodes of I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here air in the UK every night, we're here to ensure you're not locked out of ITV Hub.

Simply download and install a VPN onto your device and you'll be able to watch I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here on ITV Hub from anywhere. A VPN effectively tricks your device into thinking it's in another location by changing the IP address to elsewhere in the world.
Three simple steps to using a VPN to watch I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here
1. Download and install a VPN - we recommend ExpressVPN
2. Connect to the relevant server location - launch the VPN app, click on 'choose location' and select the right location i.e. UK for the ITV Hub
3. Head to the chosen broadcaster's live stream - in this case, head to the ITV Hub

With Australia still in and out of lockdowns, and international travel remaining uncertain with the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic, I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here will once again be setting up camp in drizzly Gwrych Castle in Wales for its 2021 series.
